document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

Distribution. Widely distributed in N.E. Turkey : Sivas , Tokat , Erzincan , Erzurum , Bayburt , Gümüşhane , Trabzon , Rize provinces ( Fig. 844 ).

Remarks. Demirsoy (1973 : 426; 1977: 83) included the female allotype of
N. sureyana Ramme
in
N. acinosus Mistshenko
, but it certainly belongs to this species. Correspondingly the specimens given as
N. acinosus
from Sivas and Erzincan by Demirsoy (1973) probably belong to this species.

The records of
Paranocaracris citripes citripes (Uvarov)
from Rize Province and
Paranocaracris citripes sabulosa Ramme
from Kopdağı given by
Mol et al. (2014)
are not likely which probably refer to this species.

Although the male holotype has yellow tibia the males of this species have mainly red, orange-red hind tibia (see the key). Three males collected from Anzer Yaylası, Rize have yellow tibia as in the holotype.
